definition: to invite/to recruit/to levy (taxes)/to draft (troops)/phenomenon/symptom/characteristic sign (used as proof)/evidence
journey/trip/expedition/to go on long campaign/to attack

sentences.english: How Far Will the Oklahoma City Thunder Go in the Playoffs?
sentences.chinese: 雷霆队能在季后赛的征程中走多远？

sentences.english: Take a journey to find your dream.
combination of community-sourced content and algorithmically-driven smarts is forging a promising path towards this potential future.
sentences.chinese: 这种结合铸造了朝向潜在未来的光明征程。

sentences.english: Some might get no farther than Bristol.
sentences.chinese: 对有些人来说，征程可能不会远于布里斯托。

sentences.english: And we don't have much time left to make that journey.
sentences.chinese: 为了奔赴征程，我们剩余的时间已经不多。

sentences.english: The quest to develop fortified genetically modified (GM) plants has yielded mixed results.
sentences.chinese: 开发强化转基因作物的征程获得了悲喜交加的结果。

sentences.english: A group of heroes begins a quest to defeat Diablo and his brothers.
sentences.chinese: 一群英雄踏上了击杀迪亚波罗和它的兄弟们的征程。

sentences.english: She said good-bye, and for the first time, they went their separate ways. Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday…
sentences.chinese: 说了声再见，她就踏上了第一次独立的征程。

sentences.english: The Chinese people are now going all out to build a well-off society in all aspects.
sentences.chinese: 中国人民正在全面建设小康社会的征程上奋勇前进。

sentences.english: The Japanese government is embarking on a long and perilous road to resuscitating its bank system.
sentences.chinese: 日本政府踏上了复兴其银行业的漫长而艰险的征程。

sentences.english: The Blues start their bid for a hat-trick of titles at home to Manchester City on Sunday.
sentences.chinese: 蓝军周日主场将打曼城，来开始他们三冠王的征程。

sentences.english: But this is just the beginning, says Dr Greenhalgh.
sentences.chinese: 但这只是千里征程第一步，格林浩尔博士说。

sentences.english: They started off to Normandie at midnight.
sentences.chinese: 他们在午夜踏上了开赴诺曼底的征程。

sentences.english: It was on to striving toward the next achievement.
sentences.chinese: 而是踏上取得下一个成就的征程。

definition: to set foot on/to step on or into
to stride toward (success)/to march toward/to take a step toward
to compose (a piece of music)/(fig.) to create, by one's actions, a narrative (generally one that can be recounted with pride)
(of a ship) to set sail/(of an aeroplane) to take off/also written 啟航|启航[qi3 hang2]
to advance singing loudly (idiom); triumphant progress
(of a ship) to set sail/(of an aeroplane) to take off/also written 起航[qi3 hang2]
mission/long-term task to which one devotes oneself/a calling
lit. to cut one's way through thistles and thorns (idiom)/fig. to overcome all obstacles on the way/to break through hardships/to blaze a new trail
